title: Who Are These Stylish People at Day 6 of Fashion Week?
text:
Photo: Liisa Jokinen Susie Lau , Fashion Writer and Blogger: “I’m wearing this outfit because I’m ready to fly back home to London tonight and these are my plane clothes.”

As the New York S/S 2020 drew to a close, photographer Liisa Jokinen was on hand to capture the fashion world’s beau monde before they jetted off to Paris, London, and Milan en masse. Photographed outside Michael Kors, Brock Collection, Batsheva, and more, these stylish individuals opened up about how and why they dress the way they do. Scroll down to learn how their looks came together.

Alex Badia, 42, style director, WWD

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Valentino jacket, Dries Van Noten shirt, old Bottega Veneta pants, and Calvin Klein tank top. 1970s porn star was my style inspiration today. My style philosophy: Have fun.”

Instagram: @thealexbadia

Annina Herzer, curator

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing Pleats Please (top), Sies Marjan (bag), Gucci (shoes), and my skirt is from Taobao. The outfit matches with my mood and activities today. I get inspired by my travels and daily impressions from my work in the art world.”

Instagram: @heannina

Alyssa Coscarelli, 25, fashion consultant

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“When I put on Brock Collection I feel like a woman. They make the most flattering dresses.”

Instagram: @alyssainthecity

Kalika Farmer, ageless, venture capitalist

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Lemaire top and trench, Shaina Mote pants, Mansur Gavriel shoes, and my necklace was designed by my close friend Malu Byrne of En jewelry. I focus on supporting designers that reflect my own passion for sustainability and creativity. My philosophy is to support designers that care about our planet and I am weaning completely off of plastic. This is my version of a power suit. I’m here representing one of my oldest and dearest friends, Batsheva Hay, who is also a Pisces like me. She’s a beauty, a romantic, and a powerful poet who possesses brains (she’s a licensed attorney) and a fabulous sense of humor. She believes in magic, always questions authority, and believes rules are made to be litigated.”

Instagram: @delphi.vc @new__age

Cassie Liu, 29, fashion editor, Marie Claire China

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a top from SINOON, I.AM.GIA pants, and Prada shoes.”

Instagram: @iamcassieliu

Sarah Brody, market and accessories director, Interview

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Balenciaga shirt and scarf with a Sacai skirt.”

Instagram: @its_brody

Tyler McCall, 33, editor-in-chief, Fashionista

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a Kate Spade dress, Le Specs sunglasses, Jennifer Fisher earrings, Madewell sandals, and Chanel bag. A few years ago I realized I felt my most comfortable self in dresses and skirts, so I’ve really been leaning into that. I thought about wearing heels today but it’s the last day and I just couldn’t bear it, so I went with sandals. I’m hoping it’s a whole ‘vacation in Italy’ vibe because it seemed like literally everyone was in Italy this summer but me! I’m inspired by feminine power dressing; I don’t think there’s anything wrong with being a little girly, even as I get older. I love women like Sarah Hoover and Stephanie LaCava who sort of subvert expectations through their style. I think it’s important to stay true to who you are with your style and not chase trends. And, as my mother taught me, if you find something you love, buy it in every color. I’m pretty much always thinking of Blair Waldorf when I get dressed.”

Instagram: @eiffeltyler

Karina Avelar, 23, accessories assistant, Vogue

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a vintage dress from my great-aunt, a Zara sweater, & Other Stories T-shirt, New Balance sneakers, thrifted bag. I knew it was going to be a crazy day at work and I wanted to wear something cute and comfortable. I wasn’t wearing the sweater originally but felt like the outfit looked too much like maternity-wear without it. My style is inspired by the people I interact with at work, random people on the street, old movies, and magazines. I usually pick one item I feel like wearing that day and go from there. My style philosophy: You can make anything work with a bit of creativity and the right styling.”

Instagram: @kar.av

Snežana Aničić van Pelt, 38, fashion designer

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a thrifted top and skirt, bathing-suit top, Nike shoes, velveteen socks, and bag and hat bought on the street. I like thrifting and picking from the street random pieces. Lately I have been combining sporty clothes and basics. I go for things that feel easy to wear and work in.”

Instagram: @snezana.anicic.van.pelt

Marion Lange, 52, executive producer

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“My jacket is Golden Goose, pants vintage, shoes Bottega Veneta, glasses vintage Silhouette. And the small bags are Bottega Veneta (pink) and Jacquemus (blue).”

Instagram: @marionyc

Brenda Weischer, 26, journalist and stylist

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“My jacket is Comme des Garçons, my top is Helmut Lang, my skirt is Georgia Alice, bag is Prada, slides Jil Sander, sunglasses Miu Miu. Everything else is in my packed suitcase as I’m flying today. My style philosophy: Comfort above all — I prefer being underdressed.”

Instagram: @brendahashtag

Molly Rae, 24, studio manager

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing all vintage except my boots which are from Camper. I get inspired by colors and patterns — and my own closet! My style philosophy: red, yellow, orange, pink, green.”

Instagram: @lettherebeneon

Karen Kaiser, 41, stylist

Photo: Liisa Jokinen

“I’m wearing a shirt by Peter Do, trousers by Givenchy, shoes Nike x Sacai, bag and necklace vintage, and Celine sunglasses. I love an outfit with ‘chic ease,’ minimal fashion that is timeless with a modern twist, mixing in vintage as well for personal flavor, and finding special vintage denim and accessories that feel lived-in and traveled.”

Instagram: @kaisergrams
description: Liisa Jokinen shoots New Yorkers with fearless personal style at her site NYC-Looks. For the Cut, she photographed the best street style at shows for Michael Kors, Brock Collection, and Batsheva at New York Fashion Week Spring 2020.
